questions.text: What is time-blocking and why is it effective?
options: Blocking people who waste your time
Scheduling specific blocks of time for specific tasks - prevents multitasking and creates focus
questions.explanation: Time-blocking assigns specific time slots to specific tasks in your calendar. Example: 9-11am deep work, 11-12pm emails, 1-2pm meetings. Benefits: (1) Prevents reactive scheduling, (2) Eliminates multitasking, (3) Ensures important work gets done, (4) Creates realistic expectations of time. Elon Musk time-blocks in 5-minute increments.

questions.text: What is the Eisenhower Matrix for prioritization?
options: A 2x2 grid: Urgent/Not Urgent vs Important/Not Important - helps prioritize tasks effectively
questions.explanation: Eisenhower Matrix divides tasks into four quadrants: (1) Urgent + Important = Do now, (2) Important + Not Urgent = Schedule (most valuable), (3) Urgent + Not Important = Delegate, (4) Not Urgent + Not Important = Eliminate. Most people live in quadrant 1 (crisis). Success lives in quadrant 2 (strategic work). Use this to focus on what truly matters.

options: Work in focused 25-minute intervals with 5-minute breaks to maintain concentration
questions.explanation: Pomodoro Technique (Francesco Cirillo): (1) Work focused for 25 minutes, (2) Take 5-minute break, (3) After 4 pomodoros, take 15-30 minute break. Benefits: maintains focus, prevents burnout, builds time awareness, makes daunting tasks manageable. The timer creates urgency and the breaks prevent mental fatigue. Adapt interval length to your needs.
